mdRecord.dcterms:title: Co-expression of Nhlh2 mRNA and Snhg14 long non-coding RNA in the Habenula
mdRecord.dcterms:description: The habenula is thought to play a role in various physiological and behavioral processes, including regulation of eating patterns. Studies have suggested that the habenula is involved in reward processing, motivation, and decision-making, which are all factors that can influence eating patterns.
mdRecord.dcterms:provenance: Virginia Polytechnic Institute and State University. University Libraries
mdRecord.dcterms:creator: Shadi Ariyanfar
